description: Two-part individual assessment: Part A (Research Summary) involves locating and critically evaluating an empirical article; Part B (Essay) requires researching, evaluating, and synthesizing psychological research into an evidence-based argument.

Group project involving researching, presenting, and analyzing psychological research, followed by proposing an original study. Submitted as a video recording, with peer and tutor evaluation of individual contribution.

Compulsory participation in psychological studies via SONA system (4 hours for 4% credit). Optional additional participation for bonus marks. Provides firsthand experience with research methods and ethics.
Comprehensive exam covering all lecture and tutorial content during the university examination period. Tests understanding of psychological theories, methods, and applications.
